    Welcome To ClimbHub!
    DUMC's Resource Platform
    Tell Me More

    About

    ClimbHub is a dynamic website for Durham University Mountaineering Club (DUMC) members to explore outdoor climbing spots (”crags”) near Durham. DUMC organises Day Meets (a day where everyone climbs outdoors) once a month, hence this website might come in handy.

    Crags

    ClimbHub provides information about famous crags near Durham that DUMC can organise Day Meets to. Information include : famous routes, grade, weather conditions and more!

    Weather Status

    ClimbHub integrates a weather API that provides real time weather information about the crag location to predict dates for Day Meets.

    Planning

    With all of the information provided, it eases the process of planning for the day meet as things like members' interests, distance and weather is all sorted.

    Community

    Learn more about Durham University's Mountaineering Club and our activities!.

    • Durham Climbing Centre

      We go to the one and only and beloved DCC as its the only climbing gym in Durham! The Mountaineering Club goes every monday and thursday, where Mondays consists of climbing and a stop at the pub afterwards and Thursdays are for team training.

    • BUCS & Local Climbing Competitions!

      For the stronger and more competitive climbers, we often participate in local climbing competitions often held in Newcastle or maybe DCC itself. However, we also represent Team Durham in the British Universities & Colleges Sport (BUCS) for climbing where we compete against other universities.

    • Club Meets!

      Personally, the most exciting bits are the various meets organised by the outdoor and meet execs. A meet is when members of DUMC take one weekend away or one day away from Durham to climb outdoors. Most anticipated meets are Day Meets, Peak Meet, Lakes Loitering an d Winter Meet!

    • Socials and Events

      Last but not least, we often have social events sometimes collaborated with other clubs such as the HillWalkers or Cave Explorers. We have formal balls aswell also organised in collaboration with other clubs.

    Almscliff Crag

    A gritstone jewel in North Yorkshire, perfect for bouldering and trad climbing.

    Almscliff Crag is a iconic gritstone outcrop standing prominently on the landscape of North Yorkshire, approximately 120km from Durham. Famous for its distinctive elephant-shaped profile, it offers exceptional friction and a variety of climbing styles from delicate slabs to challenging overhangs.

    The unique weathered gritstone offers excellent friction in cool conditions, making it ideal for autumn and spring climbing trips. Its exposed position means it dries quickly after rain but can be quite windy.

    • Location: North Yorkshire
    • Distance from Durham: 120km
    • Rock Type: Gritstone

    Caley Crags

    Premier bouldering destination in West Yorkshire with problems for all abilities.

    Located in West Yorkshire about 125km from Durham, Caley Crags is one of Yorkshire's premier bouldering venues. The area features dozens of scattered boulders and small outcrops, providing hundreds of problems across all difficulty levels. The crag is particularly famous for problems like 'Roof Route' (7A) and 'Atomic Hotdog' (7B+).

    The gritstone quality here is exceptional, with satisfying textures and a mix of technical slabs, powerful overhangs, and delicate arêtes. It's an excellent venue for groups with mixed abilities as problems of all grades are often close together.

    • Location: West Yorkshire
    • Distance from Durham: 125km
    • Best For: Bouldering

    Ilkley Crag

    Historic climbing venue with fantastic views of Wharfedale.

    Ilkley Crag, situated 128km from Durham in West Yorkshire, offers a mix of traditional and sport climbing on high-quality gritstone. The crag sits above the picturesque town of Ilkley with commanding views across Wharfedale. It comprises several distinct areas including the Cow and Calf Rocks, Rocky Valley, and the Panorama Crag.

    The area is historically significant in British climbing, with first ascents dating back to the early 20th century. Classic routes include 'Milky Way' (E3 5c) and 'The Matterhorn Ridge' (VD). The variety of climbing styles makes it an excellent venue for club trips where members have varied preferences and abilities.

    • Location: West Yorkshire
    • Distance from Durham: 128km
    • Style: Traditional and Bouldering

    Brimham Rocks

    Surreal gritstone formations offering unique climbing challenges.

    Brimham Rocks is a spectacular collection of natural gritstone formations located in North Yorkshire, just 105km from Durham. Managed by the National Trust, this unique landscape features bizarrely shaped rocks scattered across the moorland, providing some of the most unusual climbing in the UK.

    The area offers hundreds of routes across a range of grades, with particular strengths in technical off-width cracks and balancy slabs. Notable classics include 'Acorn Crack' (HVS 5a) and 'Minion's Way' (E2 5c). The setting is particularly beautiful, with extensive views across Yorkshire and unusual rock formations that seem almost otherworldly.

    • Location: North Yorkshire
    • Distance from Durham: 105km
    • Features: Unique Rock Formations

    Kyloe-In

    Sheltered sandstone gem in Northumberland offering year-round climbing.

    Kyloe-In is a sheltered sandstone crag located in Northumberland, about 121km from Durham. What makes this venue special is its sheltered position in a disused quarry, providing protection from the elements and making it climbable year-round, even in inclement weather.

    The crag offers a good mix of sport and traditional routes on high-quality sandstone, with many in the mid-grade range (VS to E2). The compact nature of the venue makes it perfect for group trips, while the short approaches and sheltered nature make it ideal for winter climbing when other venues might be out of condition. Popular routes include 'Captain Pugwash' (E1 5b) and 'Francie's Groove' (VS 4c).

    • Location: Northumberland
    • Distance from Durham: 121km
    • Rock Type: Sandstone

    Hepburn Crag

    Northumberland's hidden gem with spectacular views of the coast.

    Hepburn Crag is located in Northumberland, just 104km from Durham, making it the closest of our featured crags. This sandstone escarpment offers a peaceful climbing experience away from the crowds with spectacular views towards the Northumberland coast on clear days.

    The crag features a variety of routes from beginner-friendly Diffs to challenging E-grade climbs. Most routes are traditional, requiring gear placement, which makes it an excellent venue for practicing trad skills. The rock features interesting holds and features, including some distinctive cracks and corners. Notable routes include 'The Flake' (VS 4c) and 'Northumberland Wall' (HVS 5a).

    • Location: Northumberland
    • Distance from Durham: 104km
    • Best Season: Spring and Autumn
